page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area which was studied for our part in the Domesday Project included the village of Titchfield and the Catisfield district of Fareham. This is part of the country mid-way between the cities of Southampton and Portsmouth. Parts of the district are rural and there are also urban areas in which commuters to London live. The river Meon cuts through the land on its way to the sea at Hill Head. There is a mixture of agriculture and light industry.The major employers are Plesseys, manufacturers of electronic equipment, and the Office of Population Census and surveys, whose national headquarters is within our area. There is a mixture of ancient and modern building ranging from a Norman church to houses built within the past year.
